message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV

This paper is about domain adaptation for neural machine translation, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes novel methods for training a single translation model for multiple domains, which involves learning domain specialized hidden state representations or predictor biases. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper incorporates multilingualism into the domain adaptation framework, which could make it relevant to sub-categories such as cs.CV (Computer Vision) that deal with multilingual image and video processing.
